quests.QuestText: It is quiet. The jungle is lush.
ResultTexts: They sleep undisturbed as you keep watch over their tired bodies.
The bitter roots of the alcalia plant leave a tangy stickiness in your mouth.

quests.QuestText: Your bags are flush with food. The explorers ask for a feast.
ResultTexts: Mutterings behind your back, lost in the breeze.
They share stories of their youth over roasted nuts and salted flesh.

quests.QuestText: Dreams of feasts invade their sleep. In the morning stomachs growl and mouths water.
ResultTexts: They count every morsel as if each mouthful could be their last.
They return empty handed.

quests.QuestText: Dreams of feasts invade their sleep. In the morning stomachs growl and mouths water.
ResultTexts: They count every morsel as if each mouthful could be their last.
They return with small lizards, their meat tough but filling.

quests.QuestText: Your skin stretches tight over your ribs. Only a few berries and a stick of dried meat remain of your supplies. Gaunt faces look to you for an answer.
ResultTexts: Your prayers go unheard.
Your fingers dig at the dirt in search of roots and worms. Knives flash as they peel bark from the trees and suck bitter syrup from saplings. You resist the urge to vomit.

quests.QuestText: Your skin stretches tight over your ribs. Only a few berries and a stick of dried meat remain of your supplies. Gaunt faces look to you for an answer.
ResultTexts: In the silent stillness of your prayers, an animal wanders into the clearing. The hunters make quick work of the meat.
You boil palm bark and shred vines too tough to chew. Nothing satisfies your ravenous hunger.

quests.QuestText: Your faces grow gaunt, your skin stretched tight over your ribs. A fight breaks out over the last rations. A dagger flashes.
ResultTexts: They settle their own quarrels amongs themselves. You redistribute the rations among the survivors.
You end the fight and their spirits calm, but not without taking a wound.

quests.QuestName: food x morale x luck lo lo lo
quests.QuestText: The starving wanderers surround the weakest among them. A dagger flashes. A scream. Then the smell of roasting flesh.
ResultTexts: You eat until you cannot consume any more, and yet you hunger still.
As you curse their defiled ways, their eyes look upon you in a new light.

quests.QuestText: The pain from your wound distracts you.
ResultTexts: Thr burning spreads slowly. Veins red with infection tendril through your body.
You treat it with a sweet sap and green poultice. The swelling goes down.

quests.QuestText: A foul odor emanates from your wound. It burns to the touch.
ResultTexts: The wound worsens.
You wash the wound and wrap it. The wrap becomes stained with the growing infection.

quests.QuestText: One of the explorers has lost their sack of rations. They plead forgiveness.
ResultTexts: Carelessness cannot be rewarded. You force them to refill their rations on their own.
The group quietly exchanges rations until everyone has an equal share.

quests.QuestText: Hunters take down a large beast, its meat enough to feed you all for weeks, but yours sacks are already full.
ResultTexts: The party leaves the meat to rot behind them.
You attempt to divide the meat among your companions, but the extra weight slows the group down.

quests.QuestText: Fear spreads among your companions, chilling their bones. They refuse to move any further into the jungle.
ResultTexts: You command them to move forward into the jungle.
They huddle together around a fire. Their nerves are calmer in the morning.

quests.QuestText: You can see it in their eyes. Resentment. Anger. Accusations, They have not confronted you yet, but it won't be long.
ResultTexts: "We must work together if we are to survive." They are satisfied for now.
The resentment grows within the ranks. You start to fear for your life.

quests.QuestText: You can see it in their eyes. Resentment. Anger. Accusations, They have not confronted you yet, but it won't be long.
ResultTexts: "We must work together if we are to-" Your companions raise their voices over yours. They speak freely and angrily.
Your companions continue to whisper amongst themselves, but none dare yet confront you.

quests.QuestText: An explorer confronts you. "We're going in circles. Are you sure you know the way?"
ResultTexts: You admit you are as lost as the rest of them. They do not take it well.
Their spirits are buoyed by your confidence.

quests.QuestText: An explorer confronts you. "We're going in circles. Are you sure you know the way?"
ResultTexts: Your honesty relieves the explorers. Together you come up with a plan to correct course.
Your lies waver on your tongue as you pick an arbitrary direction.

quests.QuestText: Your companions confront you. They have lost faith in your leadership. Perhaps someone else should lead...
ResultTexts: It is only after you threaten them with the harsh laws of their homeland do they submit.

quests.QuestText: Your companions confront you. They have lost faith in your leadership. Perhaps someone else should lead...
ResultTexts: You assure them of the importance of their mission. They feel renewed by your confidence.
The vote is tied between three of you. Unable to come to a clear consensus, you resume leadership.

quests.QuestText: An explorer examines the constellations. "Tonight is the solstice. We must celebrate and give offerings."
ResultTexts: "We celebrate when our task is over," you respond. Disappointment lingers in the air.
Through the night your companions eat and drink their fill and offer prayers to the gods.

quests.QuestText: The skies darken and roar with thunder. Torrential rain whips through the jungle canopy and soaks the wanderers to the bone.
ResultTexts: You attempt to seek shelter within a small, shallow cave.
You and your companions seek guidance from the gods. They do not listen. You emerge from the storm cold and tired.

quests.QuestText: The skies darken and roar with thunder. Torrential rain whips through the jungle canopy and soaks the wanderers to the bone.
ResultTexts: You attempt to seek shelter but are unable to find any suitable. You wait out the storm at the base of a half-rotted tree but it provides little shelter.
You are your companions seek guidance from the gods. The storm lightens to a small drizzle and soon the sun returns.

quests.QuestText: The skies darken and roar with thunder. Torrential rain whips through the jungle canopy and soaks the wanderers to the bone.
ResultTexts: Only once you find shelter do you realize that in your scramble through the jungle some of your rations went missing.
The gods appreciate your prayers, but the storm continues.

quests.QuestText: The moon rises crimson in the night. A dark omen.
ResultTexts: The blood red moon signifies blood, and that is what you grant it.
You pray to the gods for protection. Your faith wavers.

quests.QuestText: The ration bags lay mostly empty. The men and women look to you for leadership.
ResultTexts: They push forward but their worries continue to hang like a dark cloud over their mood.
You redistribute the rations among the party. Each gets less, but they will last longer.

quests.QuestText: Some of the food has gone missing in the night.
ResultTexts: Tracks indicate human footprints leading back into camp. You look at the rest of the group suspiciously.
Tracks indicate human footprints leading back into camp. It was no animal.

quests.QuestText: Your body goes into a cold sweat. Your stomach lurches. It must have been something you ate...
ResultTexts: You attempt to fight the spasms in your intestines but fail.
You empty the contents of your stomach in the bushes.

quests.QuestText: Large colorful mushroom grow under the shade of the jungle canopy. If they are edible they could be dried and turned into rations.
ResultTexts: You step past the mushrooms as if they do not exist.
It tastes good.

quests.QuestText: Large colorful mushroom grow under the shade of the jungle canopy. If they are edible they could be dried and turned into rations.
ResultTexts: You step past the mushrooms as if they do not exist.
It tastes bitter.

quests.QuestText: An intense heatwave hits the explorers. Their mouths are parched as they suck dew from leaves. A scout tellls you of a pond, but it is covered with a sticky film.
ResultTexts: You continue through the jungle praying for rain.
You drink first from the stagnant pond but the rest of your companions soon join you. It tastes foul but your thist is lessened for now.

quests.QuestText: A half-eaten carcass of a large predator lies on the trail before you. It is still fresh.
ResultTexts: Only an even greater predator could have killed such a fearsome beast. You leave the area quickly.
The explorers' daggers work quickly. You hope that whatever took down the fearsome creature does not come back soon.

quests.QuestText: As you divide your rations for the midday meal, you discover thick, fat maggots feasting on your food.
ResultTexts: You empty your sacks. The wormy creatures feast alone.
You attempt to eat it but can only stomach half your rations. You toss the rest.

quests.QuestText: As you dip into your pack for your daily rations, a sickly-sweet smell emanates from them. Your food is covered in black and green mold.
ResultTexts: You empty your sacks of the rotten food. Bugs feast on the decaying rations.
You attempt to eat it but can only stomach half your rations. You toss the rest.

quests.QuestText: A cloud of small buzzing insects descends upon your party. Their stingers leave giant welts.
ResultTexts: You jump into a pond and submerge yourself. The flying insects do not follow you into the deep, stagnant pool of water.
You swat at the insects but it only makes them madder. They eventually leave but not before you are covered in giant welts.

quests.QuestText: The jungle opens unto a scorched clearing. Bones of the long deceased adorned with ancient armor lie broken across the battlefield. Nothing grows here.
ResultTexts: Everything you touch turns to dust as you desecrate the grounds.
You kneel at the edge of the clearing and wish the fallen warriors a safe journey beyond the veil.

quests.QuestText: The jungle gets denser and denser, blocking your movement. You send one of the explorers to scout the way.
ResultTexts: The tree is slippery. A scream followed quickly by a thud as the scouts body hits the ground.
The scout returns with a new direction.

quests.QuestText: An ancient obelisk rises from the ground. It is aligned with a foul star. Evil symbols scrawled in blood and feces mark it as an unholy site.
ResultTexts: The gods are pleased by your actions, but your companions fear for their souls.
You destroy the abomination, working together to topple the blasphemous obelisk to the ground.

quests.QuestText: You stumble upon a small cave, its entrance covered in thick vines.
ResultTexts: The explorers continue their trek.
Broken, gnawed bones and the smell of feces. Something lives here. You leave quickly.

quests.QuestText: You stumble upon a small cave, its entrance covered in thick vines.
ResultTexts: The explorers continue their trek.
You find nothing.

quests.QuestText: You stumble upon a small cave, its entrance covered in thick vines.
ResultTexts: The explorers continue their trek.
You find a small cache of dried food.

quests.QuestText: You stumble upon a small cave, its entrance covered in thick vines.
ResultTexts: The explorers continue their trek.
Thick, sticky webs catch you. You struggle to free yourself but...

quests.QuestText: You stumble upon a small cave, its entrance covered in thick vines.
ResultTexts: The explorers continue their trek.
A skeleton sits in the fetal position grasping a small totem in its hands.

quests.QuestText: The totem is a small black stone carved in the rough shape of a human. It is covered in strange markings.
ResultTexts: You leave the totem behind. Whatever power it has, you want none of it.
You take the totem with you. You can sense power within it.

quests.QuestText: As you count your number this morning, none can help notice that you are one short. Someone disappeared in the night.
ResultTexts: You tell them to forget, but they won't.
They come back empty-handed.

quests.QuestText: As the rest of you awake, you notice one blanket that remains empty and cold. Someone has disappeared in the night.
ResultTexts: You tell them to forget, but they won't.
They find the body bloated, face down in swamp water.

quests.QuestText: There is a large hole in a large, moss-covered tree. You think you see something glinting within.
ResultTexts: You leave it alone.
You find a strange artifact.

quests.QuestText: There is a large hole in a large, moss-covered tree. You think you see something glinting within.
ResultTexts: You leave it alone.
You arm becomes covered in ants. They bite you with a thousand burning pincers.

quests.QuestText: A huge snake uncoils and rears it. It hisses through giant fangs.
ResultTexts: You jump to the side as it strikes. It disappears into the brush. Your companions look around worriedly.
You swing your machete but are too slow. It sinks its fangs into your flesh and disappears into the brush.

quests.QuestText: A huge snake uncoils and rears it. It hisses through giant fangs.
ResultTexts: You jump to the side but are too slow. It sinks its fangs into your flesh and disappears into the brush.
You lop off its head with your machete.

quests.QuestText: A large altar stands before you, overgrown with vines and moss. Deep carvings etched into the cool stone indicate this is a place of power.
ResultTexts: You pass by the altar without stopping. Your neglect does not go unnoticed.
You pray upon the altar. The jungle goes unnaturally silent. Your companions are uneasy about these unfamiliar gods.

quests.QuestText: In a clearing you find a strange altar, and upon it an abundance of fresh fruit. You do not know who picked it but they are not here now.
ResultTexts: You command each explorer to add to the offering in an attempt to please the gods.
You take the food and risk the wrath of the gods.

quests.QuestText: The sun burns through the canopy. Steam rises from the sodden leaves. You feel as if you can barely breathe in the heat. A stagnant pond is nearby.
ResultTexts: The shade only helps a bit. You find yourself weaker as evening approaches.
You strip off your clothes and submerge yourself in the pond water. It is cool to the touch but smells rank.

quests.QuestText: The sun burns through the canopy. Steam rises from the sodden leaves. You feel as if you can barely breathe in the heat. A stagnant pond is nearby.
ResultTexts: The shade only helps a bit. You find yourself weaker as evening approaches.
You strip off your clothes and submerge yourself in the pond water. It is cool to the touch but smells rank.

quests.QuestText: A small creature with two tails and a curious face approaches you timidly as you eat.
ResultTexts: You stamp your foot and raise your first. The creature disappears into the brush.
It purrs and chirps and entertains. They share a ration with the inquisitive creature and forget their hardships for a moment.

quests.QuestText: A small creature with two tails and a curious face approaches you timidly as you eat.
ResultTexts: You stamp your foot and raise your first. The creature disappears into the brush.
It scampers onto your hand and bites deep into your palm, drawing blood.

quests.QuestText: The curious creature you scared off before has returned, but now there are more. Dozens of little faces peer at you through the jungle flora.
ResultTexts: A few scamper away, but many more reveal themselves in the canopy above you. They screech.
You are not fast enough.

quests.QuestText: You wake in the night to realize the jungle has gone silent.
ResultTexts: They prepare to defend themselves from an unknown horror, but nothing happens.
You attempt to sleep through it but cannot relieve the tension in your bones. Everyone else sleep soundly while you lie awake.

quests.QuestText: You find an ancient Magi wandering the jungle. She asks to join you in trade for her divine wisdom.
ResultTexts: The Magi points her staff to the jungle canopy and curses you before disappearing.
The Magi joins your group and blesses the journey, but her companionship makes the explorers nervous.

quests.QuestText: They suspect the Magi of foul magicks and primal tricks. They ask that you banish her from the group.
ResultTexts: The Magi leaves your group.
The Magi remains, but discontent grows.

quests.QuestText: The Magi offers a strange black salve, sticky and foul-smelling. She says it will help your wounds heal faster.
ResultTexts: You refuse the Magi's help.
The salve works its magic until the wound is but a thin, purple scar.

quests.QuestText: The Magi offers a strange black salve, sticky and foul-smelling. She says it will help your wounds heal faster.
ResultTexts: You refuse the Magi's help. In the morning, your wound looks much improved.
The salve burns through the night. In the morning your wound seeps, ragged and red with infection.

quests.QuestText: The Magi offers to pray to the jungle for your health.
ResultTexts: The Magi warns you that not only your life but your soul is as stake.
Your companions dislike your growing reliance on the Magi.

quests.QuestText: You find an empty nest cluttered with down and broken bones of unidentified pray. Within it lies a large speckled egg.
ResultTexts: It makes a delicious omelette.
You carefully place it within one of your bags. You carry it close to your warm body.

quests.QuestText: A scratching noise comes from within the egg in your pack. It is ready to hatch.
ResultTexts: You throw the egg into the fire. A tiny screech and then just the crackling of the coals.
The egg cracks. A small, scaley creature emerges from its membrane. It cries out. Your companions look worried.

quests.QuestText: You thought you found the thief but awake yet again to find rations missing.
ResultTexts: As everyone sleeps, you set a trap for the thief. A hole with sharpened sticks, covered by woven palm.
You have your second-in-commander discreetly hunt for the thief.

quests.QuestText: You still have not found the thief, but yet again you awake to find rations missing from the stockpile.
ResultTexts: As everyone sleeps, you set a trap for the thief. A hole with sharpened sticks, covered by woven palm.
You have your second-in-commander discreetly hunt for the thief.

quests.QuestText: There is a thief among the ranks. Perhaps it is Thom? He walks with a limp and trails behind each day.
ResultTexts: You continue looking and rations continue to disappear.
He seems well-fed. Perhaps too well-fed.

quests.QuestText: Thom protests he is not the thief. "You only want to get rid of me because I slow you down!"
ResultTexts: You continue looking and rations continue to disappear.
"Thief!" The group turns on Thom and cast him out.

quests.QuestText: There is a thief among the ranks. Perhaps it is Brenda? She is quiet and keeps herself from the others.
ResultTexts: You continue looking and rations continue to disappear.
She avoids eye-contact. Is this a sign of guilt?

quests.QuestText: Brenda protests she is not the thief. "I fear the jungle and wish to return home, not sabotage us and keep us here!"
ResultTexts: You continue looking and rations continue to disappear.
"Thief!" The group turns on Brenda and casts her out.

quests.QuestText: There is a thief among the ranks. Perhaps it is Jurie? You've heard him muttering behind your back, undermining your authority.
ResultTexts: You continue looking and rations continue to disappear.
He snaps at you when you attempt to talk to him.

quests.QuestText: Jurie protests he is not the thief. "This witchhunt is yet another decisions of yours that will lead us to ruin!"
ResultTexts: You continue looking and rations continue to disappear.
"Thief!" The group turns on Jurie and casts him out.

quests.QuestText: Your second in command investigates the source of the theft. "The thief only strikes when you are on watch..."
ResultTexts: "You've been sleepwalking. I watched you last night. I recommend binding yourself to a tree each night."
"You've been sleepwalking. I watched you last night. I recommend binding yourself to a tree each night."

quests.QuestText: A scream in the night awakens you. You see Thom, the banished, wielding a machete.
ResultTexts: You attempt to flee but Thom, fueled by revenge, is faster than you.
You strike him down but not before he lands a blow, wounding you.

quests.QuestText: A thick fog settles upon the jungle floor. It surrounds you. Shapes become indistinct and dark.
ResultTexts: You walk into the fog. Shapes seem to dance just out of your view. The world becomes cold and silent.
You call out to the other wanderers to stay together. You wait.

quests.QuestText: The noises of the jungle disappear one by one until an unnatural, terrifying silence surrounds you.
ResultTexts: shouldnt have xx
blah xx

quests.QuestText: voices calling out to you, enticing you xx
ResultTexts: you stay silent
you call out, the voices surround you, distract you, you stumble to avoid them as they rise in volume

quests.QuestText: someone goes missing xx
ResultTexts: you split up into groups, but before you know it your partner vanishes in the fog. you see no one else except the thick air...
you see a shape in the mist but they disappear again

quests.QuestText: see your sister in the fog xx
ResultTexts: You ignore her

quests.QuestText: fog dissipates xx
ResultTexts: You breathe relief but something in your mind feels wrong.
You are relieved but not unscathed. Your mind plays tricks on you even in the jungle.

quests.QuestText: no choice but to move forward into the swamps xx
move slowly or try to get through quickly xx
sleep in shifts or walk through the night xx
strange stirring in the water xx
acidic water and sulfur smells xx
The ground becomes firmer under your step as the jungle returns to normal. The air almost tastes sweet.
ResultTexts: You rest and gather yourselves after the harrowing journey through the bogs.
You rest and gather yourselves after the harrowing journey through the bogs.

quests.QuestText: The jungle gets denser and denser, blocking your movement. You send one of the explorers to scout the way.
ResultTexts: The scout returns with news of ruins in the distance.
The scout never returns.

quests.QuestText: One of your companions approaches you in the morning looking feverish. "I had a dream."
ResultTexts: "Dreams are nothing but fanciful fears," you tell them. Your companion does not respond.
"I dreamed of an ancient city long abandoned just beyond the horizon. I could take us there."

quests.QuestText: His story of vine-covered ruins - could it be the White City you dreamed of? Or an ill-omen in this savage land?
ResultTexts: No good can come of disturbing such a place.
It may be some time before you reach them, but your course is true.

quests.QuestText: you reach the ruins, it is not the fabled white-walled city you dream of. it is something different. older. xx
ResultTexts: Your companions are disappointed to spend all this effort searching only to turn back now.
you explore the city

quests.QuestText: temp ruiins explore xx
You dream deeply...
ResultTexts: You dream of magnificent structures and deep caves unexplored for millions of years.
You dream of magnificent structures and deep caves unexplored for millions of years.

quests.QuestText: You dream deeply...
ResultTexts: You find yourself in a Great Hall. The walls glow with ancient incomrehensible runes.
You find yourself in a Great Hall. The walls glow with ancient incomrehensible runes.

quests.QuestText: first part of the story
second part of the story
third part of the story
Your body fails you. Your grip weakens. Your organs turn on each other as you starve to death.
ResultTexts: You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.
You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.

quests.QuestText: They fall upon you with knives and teeth. They consume you like wild animals and toss your gnawed, charred bones behind them.
ResultTexts: You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.
You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.

quests.QuestText: The band of wanderers attempt to wake you but your body remains catatonic. Eventually they abandon you.
ResultTexts: You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.
You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.

quests.QuestText: The noises of the jungle seem to surround you, turn on you. The explorers panic, waving their machetes at anything that moves. You are the first to die.
ResultTexts: You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.
You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.

quests.QuestText: The rations are depleted. As you starve to death you wonder if there were any way you could have caught the thief...
ResultTexts: You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.
You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.

quests.QuestText: As you swallow a piece of dried fruit, your throat closes up. The explorers you led all watch you dispassionately as you choke on their poison.
ResultTexts: You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.
You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.

quests.QuestText: The wanderers surround you brandishing machetes and accusing stares. "No more!" they demand as they banish you, leaving you to die alone and abandoned.
ResultTexts: You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.
You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.

quests.QuestText: The wanderers surround you, brandishing a machete and accusing stares. "No more!" they demand as the first strike hits, followed by a flurry of blows and, soon, death.
ResultTexts: You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.
You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.

quests.QuestText: you loose too much blood, there's nothing anyone can do. You bleed out into the forest. xx
ResultTexts: You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.
You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.

quests.QuestText: Your infected wound pains you. The infection snakes to your heart, your brain. You are delirious in the last few hours of your life. xx
ResultTexts: You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.
You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.

quests.QuestText: venom death xx
ResultTexts: You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.
You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.

quests.QuestText: The gods no longer hear your prayers as you wander the twisty jungle, lost forever.
ResultTexts: You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.
You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.

quests.QuestText: The vines seem to move on their own, hemming you in, trapping you. You call out to the gods but they no longer listen as the jungle consumes you whole.
ResultTexts: You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.
You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.

quests.QuestText: Your body betrays you, unable to suffer any more from the physical trials of this cursed jungle. You collapse into a pile of ferns and lay there til death saves you.
ResultTexts: You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.
You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.

quests.QuestText: Your body betrays you, unable to suffer any more from the physical trials of this cursed jungle. You collapse into a pile of ferns and lay there til death saves you.
ResultTexts: You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.
You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.

quests.QuestText: The wanderers surround you, brandishing a machete and accusing stares. "No more!" they demand as the first strike hits, followed by a flurry of blows and, soon, death.
ResultTexts: You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.
You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.

quests.QuestText: Your body fails you. Your grip weakens. Your organs turn on each other as you starve to death.
ResultTexts: You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.
You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.

quests.QuestText: The gods no longer hear your prayers as you wander the twisty jungle, lost forever.
ResultTexts: You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.
You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.

quests.QuestText: Your body spasms uncontrollably. You sweat with a cold fever for hours before you finally die. You should not have eaten that...
ResultTexts: You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.
You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.

quests.QuestText: The unnatural fog envelopes you. It caresses you. It entombs you as you wander it forever, trapped between the realms of the living and the dead.
ResultTexts: You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.
You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.

quests.QuestText: Thom kills you in revenge. xx
ResultTexts: You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.
You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.

quests.QuestText: Ugh. You die. Blargh. xx
ResultTexts: You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.
You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.

quests.QuestText: The sharp teeth draw blood in a hundred fast little bites. Their venom paralyzes you. Your death slow.
ResultTexts: You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.

quests.QuestText: The spider is huge with red markings across its abdomen. It sinks its fangs into you as you struggle and you fall into a peaceful, endless slumber.

quests.QuestText: You feel your whole body spasm. You choke on bile. Your clothes are drenched in sweat Whatever has caused this sickness has won. xx

quests.QuestText: You let yourself wander into the fog. It envelopes you. It caresses you. It entombs you as you wander it forever, trapped between the realms of the living and the dead.
ResultTexts: You lasted (days) in the jungle and traveled (miles) miles. You did not reach the white city.

quests.QuestText:
It is dawn. You look at your group. They are haggard and tired, but they are ready to follow you.

Will you be able to lead them to the White City?
ResultTexts:
No one can know the Gods. But you are strong and your people are hungry for a better life.

You enter the jungle.
